solution_line_template: Jill starts off spending {day1_minutes} minutes on the phone, and the following day she spends double that {day1_minutes} minutes for {day1_minutes}*{double}=<<{day1_minutes}+{day1_minutes}={day2_minutes}>>{day2_minutes} minutes.
The following day Jill spends double the previous day's total of {day2_minutes} minutes on the phone, for {day2_minutes}*{double}=<<{day2_minutes}*{double}={day3_minutes}>>{day3_minutes} minutes.
On the fourth day, Jill spends double the previous day's total of {day3_minutes} minutes on the phone, for {day3_minutes}*{double}=<<{day3_minutes}*{double}={day4_minutes}>>{day4_minutes} minutes

On the fifth and final day, Jill spends double the previous day's total of {day4_minutes} minutes on the phone, for {day4_minutes}*{double}=<<{day4_minutes}*{double}={day5_minutes}>>{day5_minutes} minutes.

All told, Jill spends {day1_minutes}+{day2_minutes}+{day3_minutes}+{day4_minutes}+{day5_minutes}= <<{day1_minutes}+{day2_minutes}+{day3_minutes}+{day4_minutes}+{day5_minutes}={total_minutes}>>{total_minutes} minutes on the phone over 5 days.
